Say bye bye performance…

item.title: By: sqlsister
item.dc:creator: sqlsister
item.content:encoded:
I will point out that I once got someone to replace a cursor in a trigger and the import of 45000 records into that table went from taking over 40 minutes on that server to less than a minute. Of course I had to do that because I was about to build an import that would have imported 16 million records and we estimated it would take more than 11 days to run.

If you want to see some of the valid reasons for using cursors:

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1479680/ms-sql-server-when-is-a-cursor-good/1479751#1479751
